alert.note: Alert for Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 3:38PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Ocean and southeastern Burlington Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 337 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Barnegat, or 11 miles south of Toms River, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Lakewood, Barnegat, Beachwood, Manasquan, Point Pleasant Beach, Tuckerton, Seaside Heights, Surf City, Port Republic, Mantoloking, Leisure Village, Wading River, Dover Beaches North, Holiday City South, Pleasant Plains, Warren Grove, Leisure Village East, Dover Beaches South and Holiday City-Berkeley. This includes Garden State Parkway between mile markers 49 and 93. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington
